heading: file URL
comment: Unique identifier for the catalogue file, given in the xml:id attribute to the TEI root element.

heading: catalogue
comment: The catalogue in which the manuscript is recorded, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "catalogue" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: collection
comment: The collection in which the manuscript is recorded, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "collection" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: msID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "msID" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: shelfmark
comment: The shelfmark given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "shelfmark" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: crArk
comment: The crArk identifier given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "crArk" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: ieArk
comment: The ieArk identifier given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "ieArk" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: SCN
comment: The Summary Catalogue Number given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "SCN" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: TM
comment: The Trismegistos reference given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "TM" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: PR
comment: The Papyrological Reference given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "PR" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: diktyon
comment: The Diktyon number given to the manuscript in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "diktyon" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: part
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript part in an idno element which has @type "part" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: part ID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript part in the xml:id attribute to either the msDesc or msPart element applicable for this row.

heading: part type
comment: Details of the state of the part, if this differs from the broader form of the manuscript (see column AD). Common values include 'cutting', 'fragment', and 'roll-codex'.

heading: record history
comment: Details of the history of the catalogue record extracted from the recordHist element, excluding bibliographic references.

heading: source bibliography
comment: Bibliographic references contained in the history of the catalogue record given in the recordHist element, concatenated with a semi-colon where necessary.

heading: most recent change
comment: The most recent change to the catalogue record, as given in the revisionDesc element.

heading: availability statement
comment: Information about the availability of the manuscript or manuscript part, as given within the availability element in adminInfo.

heading: full digital facsimile(s)
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not a full digital facsimile exists for this manuscript or manuscript part. A value only generally appears for full manuscripts, rather than manuscript parts.

heading: full digital facsimile URI(s)
comment: The URI(s) for the full digital facsimile(s) for this manuscript part, if at least one exists.

heading: partial digital facsimile(s)
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not a partial digital facsimile exists for this manuscript or manuscript part. A value only generally appears for full manuscripts, rather than manuscript parts.

heading: partial digital facsimile URI(s)
comment: The URI(s) for the partial digital facsimile(s) for this manuscript part, if at least one exists.

heading: printed resource bibliography
comment: Printed resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "PRINT" or "OTHER".

heading: printed resource URI(s)
comment: URIs for the printed resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "PRINT" or "OTHER".

heading: printed resource ID(s)
comment: Identifiers for the printed resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "PRINT" or "OTHER".

heading: JONAS URI
comment: Entries in the JONAS database associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element.

heading: online resource bibliography
comment: Other online resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "WEB" or "ONLINE".

heading: online resource URI(s)
comment: URIs for the other online resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "WEB" or "ONLINE".

heading: online resource ID(s)
comment: Identifiers for the other online resources associated with the manuscript or manuscript part within the additional element, with @type either "WEB" or "ONLINE".

heading: form
comment: The physical form of the manuscript or manuscript part, taken from the @form attribute of the objectDesc element. Common values include codex, roll, sheet, booklet, quire, faltbuch, roll-codex, other, and unknown.

heading: condition
comment: The condition of the manuscript or manuscript part, contained within the condition element in the support description.

heading: support
comment: The primary support material of the manuscript or manuscript part, contained within the @material attribute to the support description. Common value include perg (for parchment/vellum), chart (for any kind of paper), papyrus, palm (for palm leaves), mixed (for paper and parchment), other, and unknown.

heading: watermark
comment: Details of any watermark(s) on the support of the manuscript or manuscript part, extracted from the watermark element within the support description.

heading: extent
comment: Details of the manuscript or manuscript part's extent, usually in folios. Note that the format in which this information is presented can vary, but the usual format is for counts of post-medieval endleaves to be given in Roman numerals, and counts of medieval leaves to be given in Arabic numerals.

heading: collation
comment: Details of the manuscript or manuscript part's collation, extracted from the collation element within the support description.

heading: mainStructures
comment: Details of the collation structures (that is, the number of leaves per quire) that account for at least 80% of the manuscript or manuscript part. Where multiple values are included (separated by a space), the first value is taken to be the most frequent.

heading: additions
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains additions which have been recorded in an additions element within the physical description. More granular details of these additions are included in a separate table.

heading: foliation
comment: Details of the manuscript or manuscript part's foliation, as given in the foliation element of the support description. Note that the format in which this information is presented can vary, but the usual format is for counts of post-medieval endleaves to be given in Roman numerals, and counts of medieval leaves to be given in Arabic numerals. Multiple rounds of foliation may be contained within the same field, and sometimes writing media are recorded.

heading: hands
comment: The total number of hands contained within the manuscript or manuscript part, as given in the @hands attribute to the handDesc element within the physical description.

heading: script
comment: Details of the script types found within the manuscript or manuscript part, contained within the @script element to individual handNote elements within the hand description. Common values include Anglicana, capitalsSquare, capitalsRustic, uncial, halfUncial, minusculeInsular, minusculeVernacular (for English vernacular minuscule or Anglo-Saxon minuscule), minusculeCaroline (for both English and continental variants), minuscule (for other forms e.g. Beneventan, Luxeuil, etc.), protogothic (‘praegothica’), textualisNorthern, textualisSouthern, semitextualis, cursivaAntiquior (‘anglicana’, ‘anglicana formata‘, etc.), cursiva (‘cancelleresca’, ‘bastarda’, ‘lettre batarde’, ‘secretary’), hybrida (‘semihybrida’, ‘loopless bastarda’, ‘fractura’, ‘mercantesca’), gothicoAntiqua (‘fere-humanistica’, ‘gothico-humanistica’), humanisticaTextualis, humanisticaSemitextualis, and humanisticaCursiva.

heading: mainScript
comment: Details of the main script type found within the manuscript or manuscript part, contained within the @script element to individual handNote elements within the hand description which do not also contain @scope with value "minor". Common values include Anglicana, capitalsSquare, capitalsRustic, uncial, halfUncial, minusculeInsular, minusculeVernacular (for English vernacular minuscule or Anglo-Saxon minuscule), minusculeCaroline (for both English and continental variants), minuscule (for other forms e.g. Beneventan, Luxeuil, etc.), protogothic (‘praegothica’), textualisNorthern, textualisSouthern, semitextualis, cursivaAntiquior (‘anglicana’, ‘anglicana formata‘, etc.), cursiva (‘cancelleresca’, ‘bastarda’, ‘lettre batarde’, ‘secretary’), hybrida (‘semihybrida’, ‘loopless bastarda’, ‘fractura’, ‘mercantesca’), gothicoAntiqua (‘fere-humanistica’, ‘gothico-humanistica’), humanisticaTextualis, humanisticaSemitextualis, and humanisticaCursiva.

heading: execution
comment: Details of the execution of the hand(s) in the manuscript or manuscript part contained within the @execution element to individual handNote elements within the hand description. Common values include formata, libraria, and currens.

heading: medium
comment: Details of the the tint or type of ink or other writing medium of the hand(s) in the manuscript or manuscript part contained within the @medium attribute to individual handNote elements within the hand description. Common values include ink, pencil, and colours (e.g. brown).

heading: musicNotation
comment: Details of any musical notation found within the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the musicNotation element in the physical description.

heading: decoration miniature
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as miniatures within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration drawing
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as drawings within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration border
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as borders within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration diagram
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as diagrams within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration histInit
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as historiated initials within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration decInit
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as decorated initials within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration flourInit
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations which have been classed as flourished initials within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description.

heading: decoration misc.
xpath: (//tei:msDesc|//tei:msPart)/boolean(./tei:physDesc/not(contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "miniature") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "drawing") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "border") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "diagram") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "histInit") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "decInit") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "flourInit") or contains(string-join(tei:decoDesc/tei:decoNote/@type, ""), "none")))
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the manuscript or manuscript part contains decorations within individual decoNote elements within the decoration description which have been classed as some type other than those given in the preceding columns.

heading: binding
comment: Details of the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part as given in the binding element within the binding description, excluding details of the binding's condition and any decoration, which are given in columns BH and BJ respectively.

heading: binding contemporary
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part is contemporary with the manuscript or manuscript part itself, as encoded within the @contemporary attribute to the binding element within the binding description.

heading: binding not after
comment: The date before which the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter element of the binding element within the binding description.

heading: binding not before
comment: The date after which the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore element of the binding element within the binding description.

heading: binding height
comment: The height of the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: binding width
comment: The width of the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: binding unit
comment: The unit of the binding measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "binding", within the support description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: condition
comment: Details of the condition of the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part as given in the condition element within the binding description.

heading: decoNote
comment: Details of any decoration to the binding of the manuscript or manuscript part as given in decoNote elements within the binding description.

heading: leaves
comment: An integer count of the number of leaves within the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @quantity attribute to a measure element with @type "leaf" within the support description.

heading: leaf height
comment: The height of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. When multiple values appear, they are separated by a whitespace. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf height max
comment: The maximum height of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value is numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf height min
comment: The minimum height of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value is numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf width
comment: The width of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. When multiple values appear, they are separated by a whitespace. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf width max
comment: The maximum width of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value is numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf width min
comment: The minimum width of the leaves of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within the support description. This value is numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: leaf unit
comment: The unit of the leaf measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "leaf", within the support description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: n layouts
comment: An integer count of the number of different layouts contained within a manuscript or manuscript part, calculated by counting the number of layout elements within the layout description.

heading: columns
comment: A count of the number of columns within the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @columns attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of columns is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column height
comment: The height of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column height max
comment: The maximum height of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column height min
comment: The minimum height of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column width
comment: The width of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column width max
comment: The maximum width of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column width min
comment: The minimum width of the columns of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within the layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: column unit
comment: The unit of the column measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "column", within the layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: writtenLines
comment: A count of the number of written lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of lines per column is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: writtenLines max
comment: An integer value for the maximum number of written lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: writtenLines min
comment: An integer value for the minimum number of written lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: written height
comment: The height of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written height max
comment: The maximum height of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written height min
comment: The minimum height of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written width
comment: The width of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written width max
comment: The maximum width of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written width min
comment: The minimum width of the written area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: written unit
comment: The unit of the written area measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "written", within either the layout or the support description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: ruledLines
comment: A count of the number of ruled lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of lines per column is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: rulesLines max
comment: An integer value for the maximum number of ruled lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: ruledLines min
comment: An integer value for the minimum number of ruled lines per column within the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: ruled height
comment: The height of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled height max
comment: The maximum height of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled height min
comment: The minimum height of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled width
comment: The width of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled width max
comment: The maximum width of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled width min
comment: The minimum width of the ruled area of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the layout or the support description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: ruled unit
comment: The unit of the ruled area measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "ruled", within either the layout or the support description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: rulingMedium
comment: Details of the medium or media of the ruling in the manuscript or manuscript part contained within the @rulingMedium attribute to a layout element within the layout description. Common values include ink, leadpoint, hardpoint, crayon, mixed, and board. Multiple values are possible, either within the same section or across different sections of practice, and are separated by a space.

heading: topLine
comment: Details of whether the written text in the manuscript or manuscript part begins above or below the top line of the ruling, as contained within the @topLine attribute to a layout element within the layout description. The values are usually either above or below. Multiple values are possible, either within the same section or across different sections of practice, and are separated by a space.

heading: summary
comment: A summary of the manuscript or manuscript part's contents, as encoded within the summary element of the msContents element.

heading: textLang(s)
comment: Languages contained within the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the textLang element within the msContents element.

heading: mainLang
comment: ISO code for the main language of the contents of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @mainLang attribute to the textLang element within the manuscript contents.

heading: otherLangs
comment: ISO code(s) for the secondary language(s) of the contents of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @otherLangs attribute to the textLang element within the manuscript contents. When multiple codes are present, these are separated by a space.

heading: num items and parts
comment: A count of the number of items and sub-items within the manuscript or manuscript part, determined by selecting the @n attribute to the last msItem within the manuscript contents which is not itself contained by an msItem element.

heading: work ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s) given to the work(s) within the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the title element within an individual msItem within the manuscript contents, which correspond to those found in the authority file. When multiple works are contained within a manuscript or manuscript part, the identifiers are separated by a space.

heading: title(s)
comment: The title(s) of the work(s) within the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the title element within an individual msItem within the manuscript contents. When multiple works are contained within a manuscript or manuscript part, the identifiers are separated by a semi-colon.

heading: class(es)
comment: Classes associated with the work(s) within the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @class attribute within an individual msItem within the manuscript contents. When multiple values appear, they are separated by a space.

heading: author(s) referenced
comment: Details of the author(s) given for the work(s) contained within each manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the author element within each msItem in the manuscript contents. When multiple authors are given within a manuscript or manuscript part, they are separated by a semi-colon.

heading: author ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s) given to the author(s) given for the work(s) contained within the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the author element within an individual msItem within the manuscript contents, which correspond to those found in the authority file. When multiple authors are given within a manuscript or manuscript part, they are separated by a space.

heading: origDate
comment: Details of the date of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). This value may be straightforwardly formatted as a date, but may also be formatted as prose, including identification of an individual portion of a century, or an ante/post quem.

heading: origDate when
comment: The date of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @when attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: origDate notAfter
comment: The date before which the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: origDate notBefore
comment: The date after which the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: certainty
comment: The certainty of the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @cert attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). Possible values are high, medium, and low.

heading: calendar
comment: The calendar used for the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @calendar attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). The most common value is Gregorian.

heading: origPlace
comment: Details of the place of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origPlace element  which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: country
comment: Details of the country of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a country element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: country ID
comment: The identifier given to the country of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the country element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: region
comment: Details of the region of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a region element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: region ID
comment: The identifier given to the region of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the region element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: settlement
comment: Details of the settlement of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a settlement element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: settlement ID
comment: The identifier given to the settlement of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the settlement element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: org
comment: Details of the origin organisation of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an orgName element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: org ID
comment: The identifier given to the origin organisation given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the orgName element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: origDate
comment: Details of the date of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions". This value may be straightforwardly formatted as a date, but may also be formatted as prose, including identification of an individual portion of a century, or an ante/post quem.

heading: origDate when
comment: The date of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @when attribute to an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: origDate notAfter
comment: The date before which additions to the manuscript or manuscript part were completed, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter attribute to an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: origDate notBefore
comment: The date after which additions to the manuscript or manuscript part were completed, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore attribute to an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: certainty
comment: The certainty of the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @cert attribute to an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions". Possible values are high, medium, and low.

heading: calendar
comment: The calendar used for the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @calendar attribute to an origDate element which has @type "addition" or "additions". The most common value is Gregorian.

heading: origPlace
comment: Details of the place of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origPlace element  which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: country
comment: Details of the country of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a country element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: country ID
comment: The identifier given to the country of origin given for additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the country element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions", which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: region
comment: Details of the region of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a region element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: region ID
comment: The identifier given to the region of origin given for additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the region element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions", which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: settlement
comment: Details of the settlement of origin of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a settlement element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: settlement ID
comment: The identifier given to the settlement of origin given for additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the settlement element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions", which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: org
comment: Details of the origin organisation of additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an orgName element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions".

heading: org ID
comment: The identifier given to the origin organisation given for additions to the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the orgName element within an origPlace element which has @type "addition" or "additions", which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: accMat
comment: Accompanying details included within the catalogue entry for the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the accMat element within the physical description.

heading: locus
comment: Details of any locus or loci included within a locus element within the accMat element. When multiple loci are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: person(s) referenced
comment: The names of any person(s) referenced within the accompanying material, as encoded within a persName element within the accMat element. When multiple persons are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: person ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s) given to the person(s) associated with the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to a persName element within the accMat element, which correspond to those found in the authority file. When multiple persons are given for the accompanying material to a manuscript or manuscript part, they are separated by a space.

heading: place(s) referenced
comment: The names of any place(s) referenced within the accompanying material, as encoded within a placeName element within the accMat element. When multiple places are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: place ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s) given to the place(s) associated with the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to a placeName element within the accMat element, which correspond to those found in the authority file. When multiple places are given for the accompanying material to a manuscript or manuscript part, they are separated by a space.

heading: org(s) referenced
comment: The names of any organisation(s) referenced within the accompanying material, as encoded within a orgName element within the accMat element. When multiple organisations are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: org ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s) given to the organisation(s) associated with the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to a orgName element within the accMat element, which correspond to those found in the authority file. When multiple organisations are given for the accompanying material to a manuscript or manuscript part, they are separated by a space.

heading: title(s)
comment: Details of any title(s) given for bibliographic material within the accompanying material, as encoded within a title element. When multiple titles are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: ref(s)
comment: Details of any reference(s) given for bibliographic material within the accompanying material, as encoded within a ref element. When multiple references are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: ref URI(s)
comment: Details of any URI(s) given for bibliographic material within the accompanying material, as encoded within a ref element. When multiple references are given, they are separated using a space.

heading: provenance text
comment: Details of the provenance of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a provenance element within the history element.

heading: author name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an author through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: author ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an author through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: scribe name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a scribe through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: scribe ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a scribe through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: signer name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a signer through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: signer ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a signer through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: annotator name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an annotator through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: annotator ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an annotator through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: artist name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an artist through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: artist ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as an artist through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: patron name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a patron through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: patron ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a patron through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: binder name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a binder through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: binder ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a binder through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: former owner name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a former owner through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: former owner ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a former owner through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: donor name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a donor through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: donor ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a donor through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: bookseller name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a bookseller through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: bookseller ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the provenance information within a persName element and identified as a bookseller through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: named place(s)
comment: Details of any place(s) named within the provenance information within a placeName element.

heading: place ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any place(s) named within the provenance information within a placeName element.

heading: acquisition text
comment: Details of the acquisition of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a acquisition element within the history element.

heading: acquisition date
comment: The date of acquisition of the manuscript or manuscript part, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @when attribute to an acquisition element within the history element.

heading: acquisition notAfter
comment: The date before which the manuscript or manuscript part was acquired, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter attribute to an acquisition element within the history element.

heading: acquisition notBefore
comment: The date after which the manuscript or manuscript part was acquired, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore attribute to an acquisition element within the history element.

heading: former owner name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the acquisition information within a persName element and identified as a former owner through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: former owner ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the acquisition information within a persName element and identified as a former owner through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: donor name(s)
comment: Details of any person(s) named within the acquisition information within a persName element and identified as a donor through an appropriate @role attribute.

heading: donor ID(s)
comment: The identifier(s), corresponding to those found in the authority file, given for any person(s) named within the acquisition information within a persName element and identified as a donor through an appropriate @role attribute.
